intro: Symphionema, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap, which is often used in traditional medicine. The leaves are typically alternate and ovate, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Symphionema species are often found in dry or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value or medicinal properties.
